page.title: 16Local Customs
page.content: Without a local church or school responsibility for continuing traditional customs has been accepted by LINDEAN WRI in so far as children are concerned.The large non-native element in the adult population is reflected in the lack of interest in the various events formerly associated with,for example,the grain harvest and country weddings.New Year's Eve is the only survivor.On the other hand,a new custom of which LINDEAN is the setting has recently been established: in recognition of the historical association of LINDEAN with the parish church of Galashiels,the first public event of the Braw Lad's Gathering -the Galashiels summer festival-is a visit by the principal characterrs and their mounted followers,to the number of several hundreds,to the site of the ruined church,where a service is held.
